document_metadata.title: Stage 7 Exit Criteria Test - Validation Against Required Standards

criterion_1_contested_domains_2_plus.criterion: At least 2 contested or politically sensitive data domains are identified
evidence_refs: 7.1.contested_domains.json: Deal profitability (sales vs delivery vs finance competing authorities)
7.1.contested_domains.json: Customer satisfaction measurement (operations vs external, brand positioning vs reality)
7.1.contested_domains.json: Incident frequency (operations response focus vs prevention accountability absence)
7.1.contested_domains.json: Customer count definition (sales territory vs finance reporting vs operational tracking)
7.1.contested_domains.json: Pipeline value forecasting (sales CRM vs finance external guidance)
7.3.error_tolerance_map.json: Margin performance (segment aggregation masks deal-level profitability)
7.7.epistemic_contradictions.json: Data quality standards (CRM trusted operationally while known 13-15% inaccurate)
criterion_1_contested_domains_2_plus.notes: EXCEEDS REQUIREMENT: Seven contested domains identified spanning sales, operations, finance, executive, and board levels. All domains politically sensitive involving functional authority conflicts, accountability gaps, or executive visibility tensions. Deal profitability contested between sales (CRM optimistic estimates), delivery (cost reality post-signature), and finance (external adjustment methodology). Customer satisfaction contested between operations (unmeasured), external platforms (Trustpilot 'consistently worse' 2024), and brand positioning ('Fanatical Support' claim). Incident frequency contested between operations (response tracking) and prevention accountability (frequency unmeasured). Each domain documented with authority conflicts, political stakes, and organizational consequences.

criterion_2_meaning_drift_transformation.criterion: At least 3 data transformations are shown to change meaning materially
evidence_refs: 7.2.meaning_drift_map.json: CRM sales profitability estimate → Delivery execution profitability reality (13-15% overstatement systematic drift)
7.2.meaning_drift_map.json: Operations internal forecast → Finance external investor guidance (adjustment methodology undocumented, operations visibility uncertain)
7.2.meaning_drift_map.json: Customer entity definition → Multiple customer counts (financial reporting vs territory sizing vs CRM operational counts diverge)
7.2.meaning_drift_map.json: Deal 'commitment' timing → Signature vs delivery engagement (commitment means different events T2 vs T3)
7.2.meaning_drift_map.json: 'Margin' → Segment aggregate vs deal-level profitability (aggregation masks individual deal economics)
7.2.semantic_fragility_patterns.json: 'Customer satisfaction' → Brand claim vs measurement absence vs external platform reality (term means three different things organizationally)
criterion_2_meaning_drift_transformation.notes: EXCEEDS REQUIREMENT: Six material meaning drift transformations identified with quantified impacts. CRM-to-delivery profitability drift 13-15% systematic overstatement enabled Q1-Q3 2024 margin erosion to -13%/-3% (value destruction from drift quantified). Operations-to-finance forecast drift creates operations-finance execution misalignment (operations plans on operational truth, measured on finance-adjusted truth). Customer definition drift creates count ambiguity affecting territory sizing, financial reporting, operational tracking (planning and valuation uncertainty from definitional instability). Each transformation documented with drift magnitude, decision distortion, and organizational consequences materializing.

criterion_3_chronic_error_tolerated.criterion: At least 1 chronic data error is tolerated due to convenience or power
evidence_refs: 7.3.error_tolerance_map.json: CRM profitability overstatement 13-15% tolerated across three CEO tenures 2022-2025 for sales velocity preservation
7.3.error_tolerance_map.json: Customer count ambiguity tolerated indefinitely for functional autonomy (each function counts customers suited to purpose without reconciliation burden)
7.3.error_tolerance_map.json: Satisfaction measurement absence tolerated for accountability avoidance (support not accountable for satisfaction without measurement)
7.3.selective_quality_enforcement.json: Margin erosion Q1-Q3 2024 tolerated until -13%/-3% before Q4 2024 walk away policy intervention (quarterly reporting cycle enables prolonged tolerance)
7.4.orphaned_data_domains.json: Incident frequency tracking absence tolerated enabling prevention accountability avoidance (operations measured on response speed not prevention effectiveness)
criterion_3_chronic_error_tolerated.notes: EXCEEDS REQUIREMENT: Five chronic errors tolerated, all persisting across three CEO tenures 2022-2025 indicating institutional tolerance not temporary gaps. CRM profitability overstatement tolerated for sales velocity (speed prioritized over accuracy, correction burden delegated downstream to delivery/finance/CEO rather than accuracy improved at source). Customer count ambiguity tolerated for functional autonomy (reconciliation effort avoided, each function operates on divergent counts without coordination burden). Satisfaction measurement absence tolerated for accountability avoidance (measurement would create performance visibility some prefer to avoid per Stage 7.4 analysis). Each error documented with tolerance rationale (convenience, power preservation, accountability avoidance), persistence duration (years across CEO tenures), and organizational consequences (margin erosion, retention latency, planning uncertainty, decision quality degradation).

criterion_4_epistemic_gatekeeper_identif.criterion: At least 1 epistemic gatekeeper is identified
evidence_refs: 7.5.epistemic_gatekeepers.json: Finance/CFO gatekeeping external truth through operational forecast adjustment and aggregation
7.5.epistemic_gatekeepers.json: CEO gatekeeping walk away policy criteria and deal approval authority (Q4 2024 policy)
7.5.epistemic_gatekeepers.json: Sales leadership gatekeeping CRM pipeline reality through system ownership and entry authority
7.5.epistemic_gatekeepers.json: Operations/Security gatekeeping incident narrative through technical expertise and monitoring system control

7.5.epistemic_gatekeepers.json: External platforms/customers gatekeeping satisfaction truth through information inversion (Rackspace lacks internal systematic measurement, customers post publicly on Trustpilot)
criterion_4_epistemic_gatekeeper_identif.notes: EXCEEDS REQUIREMENT: Five epistemic gatekeepers identified spanning internal (Finance, CEO, Sales, Operations) and external (customer platforms) actors. Finance gatekeeping most powerful—controls external truth through adjustment methodology (undocumented per Stage 7.2), aggregation (segment margins reported masking deal-level profitability), and investor communication authority. CEO gatekeeping through walk away policy Q4 2024 creates individual deal approval authority post-signature (T5 weeks after commitment per Stage 7.6). Sales gatekeeping through CRM system ownership enables pipeline reality control (delivery lacks T0-T1 access per Stage 7.5, sales truth monopoly pre-commitment). Operations gatekeeping through technical expertise creates incident narrative authority (frequency unmeasured, response emphasized, prevention accountability absent per Stage 7.4). External platform gatekeeping through information inversion—customers measure satisfaction externally (Trustpilot) while Rackspace doesn't measure internally, truth externalized per Stage 7.5. Each gatekeeper documented with gatekeeping mechanisms, organizational risks from gatekeeping, and power effects (narrative control, decision disadvantage, oversight impairment).

criterion_5_executive_truth_contradictio.criterion: At least 1 contradiction in executive 'truth' is documented
evidence_refs: 7.7.epistemic_contradictions.json: Deal profitability triple truth (CRM sales-optimistic estimate, delivery cost reality 13-15% worse, finance external adjustment—functional executives operate on divergent profitability truths)

7.7.epistemic_contradictions.json: Customer satisfaction dual truth (external platforms 'consistently worse' 2024, internal measurement void, brand claims 'Fanatical Support'—operations/brand executives operate on contradictory satisfaction realities)

7.7.epistemic_contradictions.json: Customer count ambiguity (financial reporting count, territory sizing count, CRM operational count diverge—functional executives use different customer counts for different decisions)

7.7.epistemic_contradictions.json: Data quality dual standard (CRM data trusted operationally for territory sizing and compensation while simultaneously known 13-15% inaccurate—executives both trust and doubt same data source)
7.7.coherence_assessment.json: Overall assessment CONTRADICTORY—enterprise functions through contradiction not despite it, executives operate in functional information silos with competing truths
criterion_5_executive_truth_contradictio.notes: EXCEEDS REQUIREMENT: Four major executive truth contradictions documented with material decision impacts. Deal profitability contradiction: CRO operates on CRM sales-optimistic truth (13-15% overstated), COO/delivery operates on cost reality truth discovered post-signature, CFO operates on finance-adjusted truth for external guidance—three executives, three truths, no systematic reconciliation per Stage 7.7 H7.7-C refutation (executive alignment hypothesis refuted, operating committee absent per Stage 4.1 enabling executive information silos). Customer satisfaction contradiction: Operations executives operate without satisfaction measurement (internal void), brand executives operate on 'Fanatical Support' claim, external reality 'consistently worse' 2024 per Trustpilot—executives operate on contradictory satisfaction realities without reconciliation. Customer count contradiction: Finance executives report external count, sales executives size territories on different count, operations executives track on CRM count—executives use divergent counts without canonical reconciliation. Data quality contradiction: Executives trust CRM data for material decisions (territory sizing, compensation, pipeline reviews) while simultaneously knowing CRM 13-15% inaccurate—dual standard enables velocity (trust operationally) while managing skepticism (adjust downstream). Stage 7.7 coherence assessment concludes CONTRADICTORY—contradictions structural, persistent across three CEO tenures, serving organizational purposes (velocity, autonomy, accountability avoidance) outweighing coherence benefits.
